citation.article-title: Paucibacter toxinivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a bacterium that degrades cyclic cyanobacterial hepatotoxins microcystins and nodularin
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Paucibacter [Pau.ci.bac′ter. L. adj. paucus few/little; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod, N.L. masc. n. Paucibacter a rod that is content with a few (carbon sources)].
Cells are rod-shaped and motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Gram-negative, oxidase-, alkaline phosphatase-, chymotrypsin- and leucine arylamidase-positive.
Can grow using Tween 40 as a sole carbon source, but utilize few other carbon sources.
The main cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0, summed feature 4 (C16 : 1ω7c) and summed feature 7 (ω7c, ω9c and ω12t forms of C18 : 1).
G+C content of the genomic DNA is 66·1–68·0 mol% (HPLC).
The type species is Paucibacter toxinivorans.
